data.name: Password Rejection
data.description:
# Password Rejection

Some computer programs try to prevent **easily guessable** passwords being used, by `rejecting` those that do not meet some simple rules. One simple rule is to reject passwords which contain any `sequence of letters` immediately followed by the `same sequence`.

Write a program which inputs a password _(between_ `1` _and_ `10` `upper case` _letters)_  and then prints `"Rejected"` if the password is rejected, or `"Accepted"` otherwise. 

### Example:

```python
APPLE => "Rejected"  # P is repeated
CUCUMBER => "Rejected"  # CU is repeated
ONION => "Accepted"  # ON is not immediately repeated
APRICOT => "Accepted"  # No sequence of letters are repeated
```


# Input/Output

- `[input]` string representing the password `BANANA`
- Constraints: 1 ≤ password length ≤ 10
- `[output]` string representing the outcome `"Rejected"`

_Source: [2000 British Informatics Olympiad](https://www.olympiad.org.uk/papers/2000/bio/bio2kex.pdf)_
